channel.description: Most recent changes with links to updates.

item.title: Version 2.4.6
item.description:
Two bugfixes

  • Setting the updater to Never would still cause it to check for updates
  • The customized attributions code would cause a crash of the plug-in on rare occasions

item.title: Version 2.4.5
item.description:
Preliminary Mountain Lion support

  • Support was added for Mountain Lion PR1. QuoteFix wasn't extensively tested on it, but it mostly seems to work okay
  • Fixed some typos here and there

item.title: Version 2.4.4
item.description:
Changes

  • Fixed check for rich-text reply
  • Added option to not show warning again when using HTML attribution on non-HTML/rich-text e-mail
  • Using current locale for last update timestamp
  • Added option to remove signatures from last occurrence of signature separator match, instead of first
  • Minor changes to signature separator matching

item.title: Version 2.4.3
item.description:
10.7.3 compatibility

  • This version should be compatible with Mac OS X 10.7.3

item.title: Version 2.4.2
item.description:
Bugfix

  • Fixed a bug which, in rare occassions, could crash Mail. Thanks to @otterbook for reporting!

item.title: Version 2.4.1
item.description:
Bugfix

  • Should fix a bug in 2.4.0 which occurs when certain international date/time formats are used in Mac OS X (thanks to Adam Nohejl for reporting this)

item.title: Version 2.3.2
item.description:
Bugfix and new "feature"

  • This version fixes a bug in displaying the last update time (which was always UTC, it should now be converted to your local timezone)
  • Added a Donate button to the preferences pane for those of you inclined to give me money ;-)

item.title: Version 2.3.1
item.description:
New Features

  • Added a menu item in the Mail menu to enable/disable QuoteFix.
  • You can now configure on what types of message quotefixing is performed.

item.title: Version 2.3.0
item.description:
Major update

This is a major update of QuoteFix. In short, it adds a proper preference pane, advanced templating for attributions, and customized signature matching.

Changes

General

  • the preferences for QuoteFix have been moved from the Mail menu to the Mail.app preferences window

Quotefixing

  • customized signature matching: you can now define a regular expression which is used to match signature separators
  • new option: increase quote level of attribution lines
  • new option: don't include a line of whitespace below the first-level quote
  • new option: "keep senders signature"
  • new option: "keep leading whitespace"
  • better compatibility with Attachment Tamer

Customized attributions

  • previewing your customized attributions
  • advanced templating (should be explicitely enabled in the Advanced preferences)
  • use HTML to style your attributions

item.title: Version 2.2.4
item.description:
Bugfix

  • Hopefully fixes signing problems.

item.title: Version 2.2.2
item.description:
Customized Attributions rewrite

  • The code which handles customized attributions has been rewritten to be much less error-prone, and at the same time play more nicely with other plugins

item.title: Version 2.2.1
item.description:
Bugfixes

  • Fixed an issue with ${message.to} variables in customized attribution
  • ${message.*.name} will now contain e-mail address if name is empty

item.title: Version 2.2.0
item.description:
Lion Compatibility!

  • QuoteFix is now compatible with Mac OS X Lion

item.title: Version 2.1.5
item.description:
Bugfixes and a new feature

  • Fixed encoding problem with attribution handling
  • Fixed problem with attribution using integer-based values (like .year, .month, ...)
  • Fixed problem with linebreaks not being shown in attributions
  • The custom attribution textfields in the preferences now allow entering linebreaks without having to hold Option

item.title: Version 2.1.4
item.description:
Bugfix

  • Removed an unused import which was causing issues with some people

item.title: Version 2.1.3
item.description:
Bugfix

  • Fixed an issue where QuoteFix could crash Mail if other plugins are loaded that use the Sparkle framework as well (issue #24)

item.title: Version 2.1.2
item.description:
Bugfix

  • Fixed an issue with customized attribution when replying to rich text e-mails (issue #23)

item.title: Version 2.1.1
item.description:
New attribution variables + bugfix

  • Added new attribution variables:
    • ${message.from}: same as ${message.sender}
    • ${message.from.name}: name of sender (as set in From-header)
    • ${message.from.email}: e-mail address of sender
    • ${response.from}
    • ${response.from.name}
    • ${response.from.email}
  • Fixed bug in encoding of certain attribution parameters, which caused ${message.sender} not to show the e-mail address but only the name of the sender (if any)

item.title: Version 2.1.0
item.description:
First official 2.x release!

This is the first official release of the 2.x version of QuoteFix.

Since 2.0.4, nothing has changed, apart from the version number.
